page.title: 01Sutton & Bignor, W. Sussex
page.content: This block in the South Downs, is extremely undulating with hills rising to 212 metres. The landscape is very varied with frequently alternating woodland and farmland and with wheat grown up to the tops of the Downs. No other crop except grass is grown. There are no A or B class roads in the block; most roads are narrow and winding, often between high earth banks on both sides. Sutton and Bignor and the only nucleated settlements, being less than 1 km apart and standing on opposite sides of a valley. Because of the isolation of the block, there has been little new housing development and there is an almost total lack of amenities with much dependence on private transport. However, many older houses have been rehabilitated and many timber framed houses have survived.
